title: Definitions
context: PART II. EXPORTS: FRUITS, VEGETABLES, NUTS, COFFEE, AND HONEY Note Part heading amended by L 1983, c 257, §5; L 2008, c 167, §4. §147-21 Definitions. For the purposes of this part, unless otherwise required by the context: &ldquo;Agricultural commodity&rdquo; means fruits, [vegetables], nuts, coffee, and raw unprocessed honey. &ldquo;Commercial exporter&rdquo; means any person who is engaged in the business of exporting fresh or processed agricultural commodities to points outside the State. &ldquo;Department&rdquo; means the department of agriculture. &ldquo;Processed&rdquo; means canned, preserved, frozen, pickled, dried, or otherwise prepared with or without any ingredients added thereto. &ldquo;Raw unprocessed honey&rdquo; means honey that has not been heated above one hundred twenty degrees Fahrenheit, or filtered through a fine screen of less than one-sixty-fourth inch mesh, or treated with diatomaceous earth, or in any other way that results in the loss of any natural constituent of honey, such as plant pollen and enzymes. &ldquo;Style&rdquo; means the kind or class of any particular processed agricultural commodity as determined by its physical characteristics, usually the size and shape thereof. [L 1955, c 258, §3; RL 1955, §22-21; am L 1959, c 267, §1; am L Sp 1959 2d, c 1, §22; am L 1961, c 132, §2; HRS §147-21; am L 1983, c 257, pt of §5; am L 2008, c 167, §5]
